intro: Dalenia beccariana, commonly known as the Beccarian dalena, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
